p: The licorice plant, Glycyrrhiza glabra L., was reported to have specific anti-SARS effects (Polansky and Lori 2020). Constituents of licorice include triterpenoids such as glycyrrhizin or glycyrrhizic acid ( 5). Glycyrrhizin ( 5) exerted very high antiviral activity and in vitro inhibition of SARS-CoV (EC 50 300 μg/ml) (Cinatl et al. 2003). Glycyrrhizin and its derivatives inhibited SARS-CoV replication in vitro (Baltina et al. 2015).
